question: Why don't you go back to doing something you're good at... like that Lonelyhearts column? I'll take a refill there, Betty...
answer: Hey, Sheriff. How's everything?

question: Oh, you know, the usual... keeping the world safe.
answer: ... I meant your food.

question: Oh, right... 's fine. Thanks.
answer: I thought you said the eggs weren't...

question: It's fine. Mind your own meal...
answer: You should get the order you want.

question: Why you always gotta embarrass me? I been eating lunch with you since grade school and you always gotta embarrass me!
answer: They're just eggs, Elden, how embarrassing can eggs be?

question: ... plenty
answer: Who eats eggs for lunch, anyhow?

question: Blake, I can handle that transplant!
answer: We need someone with the right kind of experience, Lonnie.

question: Even if he's falling asleep on his feet?
answer: Lonnie, it's a complex procedure. Why don't you observe?

question: I'm not some snot-nosed resident fresh out of medical school, Blake.
answer: No, you're not. You're a good doctor, Lonnie, but you're not David Ravell. I've made my decision. Now, if you'll excuse me ...

question: One candle... uh-oh, you're getting up there! Doesn't David like 'em young?
answer: I'm over the hill, what can I say?

question: ... but keep putting off thanks to a certain husband we won't mention...
answer: Oh, guys, you didn't have to do that!

question: So how you gonna celebrate? Del takin' you into Wichita for a big fancy dinner?
answer: Yeah, Dairy Queen, maybe... Oh, I should probably call him. Thanks, you guys...

question: Hi Del, it's me. I guess you're busy. I know you want the Oldsmobile back tonight, so... I was wondering if I could take one of the new Buicks.
answer: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hang on a second there, baby. Why do you need one of the new Buicks?

question: Oh, you're there. You sound out of breath.
answer: I ran back in to get the phone.

question: I don't need one, but it's kind of a special night, and--
answer: What's so special about it?

question: Sue Ann's taking me out and I thought it might be fun to go in a nice car...
answer: Nothing... it's, ahh, busy here. Look, you don't need a LeSabre to go out with Sue Ann. Take the blue Corsica. I'll see you when I get home. Shit! Joyce, open the damn gate, will you?!

question: Uhh, no, we haven't picked a date yet... well, once he dumps her we will. He's out pricing banners... I don't expect him back.
answer: "Banners?"

question: You know, flags and shit... he said "for a livelier look" or something.
answer: No, I was just... How you doing?

question: Great. Good. Content...
answer: Oh. How come?

question: I dunno. Job satisfaction, I guess...
answer: They're fine... you miss it?

question: You must be joking.
answer: Hmm.

question: Oh, yeah, he's got things up and running, alright...
answer: 'Kay, good. Bye, then...

question: Uh-huh. Anyway, I'm thinking Easter, 'cause I just fucking love pastels.
answer: Oh, Christ, what am I gonna do with you? We deserve this.

question: Oh, Christ, what am I gonna do with you? We deserve this.
answer: Hey, darling... oww! Sorry, got my own little Gulf War going on here.

question: Did you watch it yet?
answer: Sure did. I'll tell you, if that man was any better looking it'd be a crime 'a some sort...

question: Yep. Hey, I got a surprise for tonight. We're going to the Starlite in style!
answer: Oh, Betty--

question: I'll give you a hint. If you scrunch up your eyes a bit it looks just like a Jaguar...
answer: Honey, I'm really sorry, I was gonna call you about tonight. Larry's got a lodge meeting. There's no way I can get a sitter this fast.

question: No... what about your sister?
answer: I can't ask her again-- Nathan, stop it! Jesse, don't take that, hit back!-- I feel terrible, hon.

question: It's all right.
answer: You sure? Maybe next week we could...

question: Uh-huh. No, we'll do it later. 'S only a birthday, right? I'll have another one next year...
answer: Aahhh...

question: What?
answer: The LeSabre!

question: Maroon.
answer: What?

question: He wasn't going to let us use it, so I just took it.
answer: Oh, I wish we could just get in it and drive, and drive, and drive!

question: Yeah, me too.
answer: Sorry, hon. Happy Birthday...

question: I gotta go make dinner. Sure you don't want any salad?
answer: No, I do not want any goddamn... what was all that shit on the phone about the new Buicks?

question: I told you. Sue Ann was gonna take me out tonight, but...
answer: She's not comfortable in a Corsica? 'S got air and leather...

question: I took the blue Corsica, Del. Relax.
answer: All right, then. Actually, I'm glad you're going out. I got something going on tonight. Some serious clients, with real potential.

question: ... like the water purifiers?
answer: What?

question: Or the vitamins? Or the...?
answer: Hey, the FDA screwed me on that when they changed the law, and you know it!

question: I got you, Del...
answer: ... well, then you ain't got much.

question: Oh, I know.
answer: Couple 'a guys in from outta town. They want to see the new LeSabres.

question: Just knock it off, 'kay? Anyhow, they're 97's, they're not even new.
answer: They're new to us...

question: Yeah, I guess there's nothing like watching those tenpins fall, huh, Del?
answer: That is a skill!

question: Wesley... Your wife's a very lovely woman. Have I seen her before?
answer: If you ate at the Tip Top you did.

question: Oh, yes, with the coffee...
answer: Yep, Betty pours a pretty mean cup.

question: I like this. I like doing business in the home. It's cozy... Who's birthday?
answer: Ahh... my wife's.

question: Yeah, well, I don't have time to screw around. I got buyers in Dallas, Houston and Vegas who are ready to snap this stuff up.
answer: We appreciate that. But you just poured me a drink, I'd like to enjoy your hospitality for a few minutes.

question: Fine. You got five...
answer: It's a nice place you got here. Real comfortable. Sweet little town, Fair Oaks. You like it here?

question: You better believe it.
answer: Could you give us an example?

question: Of what?
answer: I'm asking you for an example of one of these dumb fucks being a dumb fuck.

question: I don't follow...
answer: You're not a dumb fuck, are you, Del?

question: No...
answer: I didn't think so. So, give me an example of a stupid person doing a stupid thing. Not being stupid, you're equipped to recognize it.

question: You did not just say "Injuns," Del.
answer: The Indians, Injuns, whatever. They're always drunk and doing stupid things.

question: Like what?
answer: Driving their cars into trees... puking on the sidewalk... stupid shit!

question: Let's see... around here that would be Kiowa, Kickapoo or Osage, if I'm not mistaken.
answer: I... I don't know...

question: Well, my idea of stupid is very different from yours.
answer: My socks?

question: ... and put them in your mouth. Now I'm gonna tell you what stupid is. Stupid is taking something that doesn't belong to you. Right Wesley?
answer: That's right.

question: Stupid is trying to sell it to other people who are, by their very nature, untrustworthy.
answer: That is so right.

question: Stupid is calling people in Kansas City who are affiliated with the rightful owners of the thing you stole, and trying to sell it to them. Right Wesley?
answer: Now, that's really stupid.

question: So you see, we have totally different ideas of what's stupid and what's not. Don't we?
answer: Hell of a way to die.

question: It wasn't always fatal, Wesley. We could scalp Del right now, and he'd be plenty alive to tell us how it feels. It's pretty simple, too.
answer: A mark, huh?

question: Consider yourself lucky. Luckier than those 'Injuns' you have such contempt for.
answer: IT SURE IS!!

question: JESUS CHRIST!!! Are you out of your mind? You scalped him!
answer: You told me how to do it!

question: That was to get him to talk! This is great - just great! Now we don't know where the goddamn stuff is.
answer: He told us it's in the Buick.

question: We don't know which Buick, do we?
answer: Well, why'd you shoot him?

question: Elden called me. He wants to, ahh, make a statement for the paper... Hey, Betty. Are you okay?
answer: I'm great, good, content. What happened to your arm, Roy?

question: Oh, nothing, it's fine. I just need to keep it wrapped for a few...
answer: Make sure it's elevated...

question: Uh-huh.
answer: You want me to make you a sling? It's no problem...

question: Well, I was worried about you and I wanted to make sure you were alright... and I guess I was sort of hoping I could ask you about what happened...
answer: Oh, that... Sure, I saw the whole thing. It was disgusting!

question: My God... did you get a look at who did it?
answer: Yes.

question: You did? Was it anyone that you...?
answer: It was Chloe...

question: Okay, let's go... I got nothing for the record yet.
answer: Oww! My arm, careful!

question: Ahh, what'd you do now... fall off your bike again?
answer: No, it's nothing, I... my piranha just mauled me a little when I layed their food out.

question: Good God...they're meat eaters, Roy, just drop the shit in there!
answer: I can't...they prefer a more formal presentation. I don't usually go so close to the surface, but I was...

question: ...you are so goddamn weird.
answer: No, Elden, I need to...

question: You need to get yourself gone from my crime scene. And leave Betty alone, she's...
answer: She knows who killed Del. Elden, she said it was a woman.

question: It wasn't a woman.
answer: Yes it was. Betty saw the whole thing! Your killer's name is Chloe...

question: I'm tellin' you it wasn't no woman, Roy!
answer: Jesus...

question: You think a woman did that?! Kinda' looks like a burnt out roman candle, don't he?
answer: So, you think you're gonna find his scalp hanging in some tepee?

question: They no longer live in tepees, Mr. College Graduate.
answer: Did you send anyone out there?

question: You bet I did. I got a squad car on the way to the reservation right now.
answer: Bad idea ...

question: You just go write your little story, Roy. I'll handle the police work...
answer: You better handle what's in this garbage can first.

question: I still don't understand how you knew Del was telling the truth.
answer: I saw his soul Wesley. He was face to face with his God, and no one lies in that situation. But your Geronimo act rattled me, and I abandoned my instincts.

question: I didn't. You gave me a look!
answer: What 'look'?

question: That one look you got! I thought you were done, so I took him out...
answer: I wasn't done, I was just sick of hearing him whine. And you didn't take him out, you scalped him. Christ, I almost puked, did I tell you that?

question: Well, why'd you have to tell that Indian story?
answer: What the hell does that mean? If I'd told a Ty Cobb story would you have clubbed him to death with a bat?

question: You just gonna leave these cars sitting here like this?
answer: Why not, it'll confuse 'em... gotta do something, now that you fucked it up.

question: I wanted to make a statement.
answer: Let me tell you something. In our business you can't put food on the table if your phone doesn't ring. The guys who get the calls are good - not flashy, just good. They get in, they get out. Nobody knows a goddamn thing. Understand? Boom, boom, boom. Three in the head and you know they're dead.

question: ... that's a good motto.
answer: Fine, I'll get you a bumpersticker, but you better start believing it! It's the only statement you need to make.

question: I questioned Joyce about all this...
answer: Yeah?

question: Seems she was pretty familiar with 'ol Del. On a regular basis, if you get my drift...
answer: ... and half the other guys in this town. Including you, I believe...

question: Junior year!
answer: Anyway, so what?

question: So? ... Suppose Betty found out about them?
answer: You said a woman couldn't have done it.

question: A woman can write a check.
answer: So you're saying Betty Sizemore - our Betty Sizemore--who you were in swing choir with--has now hired somebody to scalp her husband in her own kitchen while she watched? You're amazing.

question: 'S just a theory...just 'cause I'm thinking it don't mean I like it.
answer: She's in a kind of shock. I see all the signs of a post-traumatic reaction with possible dissociative symptoms.

question: Could I have that in American?
answer: It's a type of altered state...it allows a traumatized person to continue functioning.

question: So she did witness it?
answer: Oh, you're sharp as a tack, Elden.

question: That's it! YOU'RE GONE!
answer: Oww, the arm, the arm!

question: You just don't know when to quit, Roy! You were jealous of me when I got hall monitor in seventh grade, and you're still jealous now!!!
answer: One question, Doctor, please! You can't do this! I'm the press, I have rights!!

question: Let me know if you need anything, okay?
answer: Are you and Larry happy?

question: Oh, I dunno... enough, I s'pose.
answer: Then you should treasure that... you gotta hold on to whatever you got that's any good, even if it's only a little bit.

question: All you been through... I ever tell you what a good friend you are?
answer: All the time...

question: Well, you are.
answer: Something bad happened to Del and me, didn't it?

question: Yeah, hon. Real bad. You just get some sleep, everything's gonna be fine.
answer: Sue Ann, I'm sorry about all this, but I just know there's something special out there for me...

question: I'm a Yankee, myself. Massachusetts.
answer: Here's Ghengis Kunt and The Demilitarized Zone. Get it? They're Korean, so they're pretty hot.

question: You know, it's interesting. The South lost the Civil War, but they still seem to get all the glory.
answer: Huh?

question: Jeb Stuart, Stonewall Jackson, Jefferson Davis - they're all losers in my book.
answer: The fuck you talking about?

question: Even Robert E. Lee was a loser.
answer: He goin' crazy on us, or what?

question: Did you know the most brutal, inhumane prison of the entire war was in Georgia?
answer: Really. And where was that, old man?

question: ... So, at a rest stop outside Logansport you noticed that two guys were slipping something extra in one of your cars, and you decided to see what it was. Then you figured you'd take this valuable commodity and go into business yourself, even though it didn't belong to you. But you needed a crackerjack salesman to move it, so you made the biggest mistake of your short life and chose Del. Sound right so far?
answer: Actually, I scalped him, and then you killed him.

question: Exactly. Ohhh ... There weren't four, were there? You know you're going to die, don't you, Duane? And you really don't know where that other LeSabre is, do you?
answer: Should I kill him now?

question: God, I admire that. Ya see that, Wesley? That's why they get all the glory.
answer: ...why'd you spit on me?

question: Come on, Wesley, three shots.
answer: Well, no one ever spit in my face before. Especially some cracker fuck.

question: SHHH!... BETTY? WHERE ARE YOU?
answer: I'm in a motel. Has something happened to Del? Did he do something stupid?

question: BETTY, I NEED TO TALK TO YOU...IN PERSON! WHERE'RE YOU AT?
answer: IF THIS IS ABOUT DEL, FORGET IT! I'M NOT COMING BACK!

question: GODAMMIT, BETTY! ... WHO'S CHLOE?
answer: I'M THROUGH TALKING NOW! GOODBYE!

question: The Assistant Manager, Mr. Wylie. Only to say he was wearing green.
answer: What if the killers didn't see her? You published her picture - you're gonna get her killed!

question: No, we're bringing the community into the effort to find her.
answer: You're lying!

question: I spoke to Betty Sizemore yesterday. That's right. There's no doubt in my mind, folks... she's on the run. Whether or not she's mixed up in all this remains to be seen...
answer: That's bullshit, Sheriff! You think she's a suspect!

question: So how do we know that car's still in Fair Oaks?
answer: We don't. But a '97 Le Sabre'll be easy to find if it's here, town this size...

question: I can eat because I know we didn't kidnap that woman. I can eat because they aren't looking for us. And I can eat 'cause I'm fucking hungry... ... relax. She's gonna end up on a milk carton and that's about it.
answer: I hope you're right...

question: ... I know I am. Let's just do what we gotta do here, and get the fuck gone.
answer: She got out of town awfully fast. And wasn't she quiet in that house? I think most women would have screamed, don't you? I know they would've...

question: Mrs. Rogers? I'm Dwight Campbell, with Neighborly Life Insurance. I'm looking for Betty Sizemore.
answer: I wish I could help you, but I can't.

question: Aren't they precious?
answer: No.

question: I see. And are you in touch with Mrs. Sizemore?
answer: No. But I'm taping her show every day so she can watch it when she comes back.

question: Her show?
answer: "A Reason to Love."

question: I see.
answer: I don't think she will. She's a slut, but I just don't think she's that mean. Jasmine'll bring her around...

question: ... and how long did she work here?
answer: Oh, five years, give or take.

question: Hmm... you two in high school together?
answer: Aren't you a sweetheart... no, not quite. Anyway, she's been with us awhile.

question: But she wanted more out of life, right?
answer: No... she just wanted something outta life. Anything. And with Del, she wasn't getting nothing. That's her husband, Del. I'm sorry about what happened and all, but that's the way I feel about all of this...

question: I see. May I?
answer: If it helps bring her back, be my guest...

question: Thank you for your cooperation.
answer: ... who doesn't?

question: ... and what kind of car does she drive?
answer: Well, she wanted a LeSabre, but Del made her use that blue Corsica...

question: Did you say LeSabre?
answer: Look, she didn't kill Del over no car if that's what you're thinking.

question: But she could have taken one, right?
answer: Maybe, but I don't think she had the nerve. I know her. And I'm a pretty good judge of character...

question: Would you mind very much if I changed the channel at three o'clock?
answer: Yes.

question: Please? It's very important to me. "A Reason to Love" comes on at three around here.
answer: ARE YOU DEAF?!!

question: That's real funny. Why don't you have another drink?
answer: What's the matter here?

question: I begged him to let me put that on!
answer: He's a prick. Merle?... You're a prick. So you're into "Reason," too? Finally, someone civilized! I'm Ellen, what can I get you?

question: Hi, I'm Betty. I'll take a Miller, if you got it...
answer: What's that bitch up to now?

question: Williams, Arizona. About halfway there, I guess.
answer: Halfway where? You've gotta come home. We've been worried sick about you. Are you alright?

question: Sue Ann, I thought you of all people would back me up on this, you know what Del's like. How did he take my note?
answer: Betty, honey, listen to me. A man came by from Mutual Life Insurance. He says you've got money comin' to you from Del's policy.

question: What are you talking about? Tell Del I'm sorry. I left so quick, but I need to do this.
answer: Do what?

question: I gotta go.
answer: Betty! Listen to me! Del is ...

question: If that little weasel ever walked in here I wouldn't serve him.
answer: I'd slap his face.

question: I'd kick him in the nuts, if I thought he had any. Where you headed, Betty?
answer: Los Angeles, California.

question: And you called your friend, and she's telling you not to go? When I went to Europe my friends told me I was crazy.
answer: Europe? The Europe? This is my first time out of Kansas.

question: I should call you Dorothy.
answer: Did you love it?

question: Sure I loved it! It was great. Let me tell you something. I got groped by these Tunisian guys who thought I was a slut for wearing shorts, it was hotter than stink the whole time, and I got some kind of weird gum disease from the water. Plus, it ended my marriage--
answer: That's horrible!

question: No, he was a toad. Even more of a toad than Merle... I just wear the ring to keep the flies away. Rome was the best thing I ever did, because I DID IT! And I swear to you, it changed me. I've been to Rome, Italy! I sat every morning at the Cafe Sistina and had my cappuccino, and watched the pilgrims walk to mass, and no one can ever take that away from me.
answer: I left my husband two days ago.

question: Really?
answer: I'm getting back with my ex-fianc. He proposed to me right around here, so I guess this is just sort of a sentimental stop...

question: Wait, I thought you said you'd never been outta Kansas...
answer: Oh. I mean, except for that.

question: Nice move. Cedars Sinai?
answer: No. Loma Vista.

question: I s'pose his name's David Ravell.
answer: How did you know?

question: What's his real name?
answer: Dr. David Ravell.

question: You mean... George McCord, the actor?
answer: No, I mean David Ravell. He's a surgeon.

question: Yeah, I know, we just watched him together, remember? Up there on the TV. Good God Almighty ... You're serious. I've heard about people like you. Piss off, Merle. So how you gonna find him, Betty?
answer: I'll go to the Hospital.

question: What if you can't find him? What if you get out there, and nothing's the way you thought it was gonna be?
answer: Like Rome?

question: Worse.
answer: You made out alright.

question: Yeah, but at least I knew Rome was gonna be there when I arrived...
answer: Ellen, this is the biggest thing I've ever done, but I've gotta do it.

question: You take care of yourself then, Betty, and don't let anybody stop you...
answer: To tell you the truth, I can't believe I've made it this far. It may not be Europe, but I just know there's something special out there for me...

question: So she gets rid of the asshole and is set for life in the same day.
answer: You think so? Joyce says she's timid.

question: Joyce was screwing Del.
answer: ... among others.

question: I'd say that about torches her credibility, wouldn't you?
answer: Yeah, well, if the wife's trying to sell it she'll fuck up. She's an amateur, just like Del was.

question: Sorry, you've got the wrong number. No, I see Betty as a Midwestern Stoic type. Ice water in her veins. A clear thinker. Probably a Swede or a Finn.
answer: A 'Finn?' What is a Finn?

question: You should read more. Listen to me. I think this woman was waiting for a chance to do this, and we gave it to her. She kept to herself for years, living with a pompous asshole. Then she sees her opportunity, and BOOM! - she leaves that little mudpatch in the dust. These heartlanders can't figure it out, 'cause that's not their sweet little Betty. Hah! We've been tracking her for, what, three days and I already understand her better'n most the people in that shitty little burg.
answer: So what the fuck's a Finn?

question: Oh, for Chrissakes. It just means the kind of person who can eat shit for a long time without complaining, then cut their momma's throat and go dancing the same night.
answer: Like... us?

question: Very graceful. Perfect form.
answer: Would you say she was ambitious?

question: Wise beyond her years, I'm sure, and such poise, too. Very, very impressive...
answer: Well, then, did you ever get any indication that she wanted to leave her husband?

question: What do you mean? Mrs. Blaine? I can tell you right now, without a doubt, that your granddaughter is alive, and did not kill Del Sizemore.
answer: ... why do you think you have to be missing a piece of your soul to kill somebody? What are you talking about? Killing's totally natural. It's dying that isn't natural...

question: God... I still look like a waitress.
answer: Of course, I don't know every doctor who works here...

question: Dr. Ravell's the finest surgeon on the staff. You must know him. He's incredibly handsome, gentle, considerate. He's being sued for sexual assault right now, but-- It's not true. He was set up.
answer: Well, I certainly would have heard about that.

question: Of course, he's only here two days a week. He's also on staff over at Loma Vista.
answer: ... I don't think I know that hospital.

question: It's in a very pretty area that gets a lot of sun, has palm trees out front, mountains in the background...
answer: Really? You've just described all of Southern California. Well, I'm sorry, but I can't even consider you without references or a resume. And frankly, I don't know how you could have forgotten them.

question: There... you rest now. I'm... I'm Nurse Betty. DAVID!!!
answer: SOMEBODY HELP US! PLEASE, SOMEBODY! Please! Danny, it's gonna be all right!

question: He has no heartbeat!
answer: You're hurting him!!

question: I'm massaging his heart. I saw it done once.
answer: ARE YOU CRAZY?!! STOP IT!!!

question: LISTEN TO ME! IF I DON'T DO THIS, HE'S DEAD! All right, we're moving him inside! Give me a hand!
answer: Is he gonna live?

question: Thas' it, thas' it... conquer that bitch.
answer: It's not an exact science, Wesley. He said they'll be here... My Houston contact has always been very reliable.

question: And then we're gonna do her right here. Right?
answer: You're always so coarse... "Do her right here." Let's just see what happens, okay? "I wish that I could find a way; To speak my thoughts on Mother's Day. There are no words that quite express; My gratitude or happiness. A pleasant smile perhaps a kiss; I would not fail to give her this. I'd make her glad the whole day through; By sayin' 'Mother', I love you!' P.S. I wish I could say this to my mother's face, but I can't anymore." Wait, wait a minute. We have a major miscommunication here. This not Betty. This is not even close to Betty... Then I'm sorry... Wrong Betty.

question: Let's get out of here. We got another long drive ahead of us.
answer: Betty would never dress like that. She's not some trailer park slut! And she doesn't have a sewer for a mouth...

question: Okay, thank you, goodbye... Keep in touch...
answer: ... She's got class, and poise. Lots of poise...

question: What you did yesterday was reckless at best. You are not an employee of this hospital! If that boy dies I don't even want to think of the lawsuit that'll follow. Are we communicating here?
answer: Yes, ma'am.

question: Good. I'm prepared to offer you a job. You can help out in the pharmacy until your California certification and references arrive, but you are not to touch anyone. Is that totally clear? Fine... You can start tomorrow. And don't say a word about this to anyone. Is that issue?
answer: Umm... yes. Back home.

question: Hey, it's Supernurse! Betty, right? We can't forget what you did yesterday ... How can my family ever repay you?
answer: Tell her I was just--

question: She doesn't care if it was just your job... Danny would be dead now but for you.
answer: I'm not. I just drove in from Kansas.

question: So why'd you come to L.A.?
answer: I came for love. My fianc is here.

question: You're making me look bad... My mother says I wouldn't move across the street for love.
answer: It's something I had to do. For David.

question: 'David.' That's your guy. So, you staying with him?
answer: No... I don't really know where he is yet. I'm at a hotel around the corner.

question: Man, that is love. What? Ahh, Mom says you should stay with me... Okay, yeah, why not? You can go get your stuff right now. I'll walk you down.
answer: No, that's not, I couldn't...

question: Listen, when someone does the kind of thing you did, you gotta do something in return. So, you stay with me until you find your David and live happily ever after. Okay? You okay? This neighborhood, you get used to it...
answer: The one you were telling me about?

question: No, this one was worse...I had to have the place sprayed when he left. Twice... He was two guys before the last one--not counting a little office thing in there, which I'm trusting you with, 'cause if it gets out, I'm on the street...
answer: It's lovely...I really like your aquarium.

question: Yeah, well, at least fish don't use your razor or pee on the seat...
answer: Hmmm. Sounds like you've had a pretty tough go of it with men...

question: No, we don't know where she is... I understand... No, we'll find her...
answer: What'd they say? Can we go back to Detroit?

question: They said find it. Find her, find it. Finish the job you were paid to do.
answer: Half.

question: What?
answer: They paid us half. They still owe us half...

question: There it is again. That lousy attitude that got us here in the first place. That "make a statement," do an end zone dance, shake your ass and sue everybody in sight attitude that's dragging this whole country down the drain.
answer: I know that.

question: AND TURN THAT FUCKING MUSIC OFF!
answer: Worse... you're in Texas.

question: I can't find Loma Vista Hospital... I don't believe this! You're the second person here who's told me that. That's like Ford saying they never heard of GM! Hey, Rosa...it's Betty. How do you get to this town called 'Tustin?' It's in Orange County...
answer: Tustin? Take the Hollywood Freeway to the Five...

question: The Five?
answer: Just look for the really crowded road and follow that.

question: Okay...oh, umm, would you mind if I borrowed some clothes?
answer: Huh? Sure, look in my closet, take any dress you want! You made it! Hey, that looks great on you. 'S classy... So, how'd it go today? You find him?

question: Ummm...no, no. Different 'Ravell.'
answer: What are you talking about? This bar is packed with professional people!

question: I know what you mean, I recently had some trouble with a man, a different man...and David's still getting over Leslie. His wife.
answer: He has a wife?!

question: Had. She died in a car accident last year. She was decapitated.
answer: God, that's awful!

question: It may not have been an accident. They never did find her head...
answer: Her 'head'?! You're making this up...

question: No, no! Well, see, she was having an affair with a Russian diplomat who I believe was mixed up with the Mafia...
answer: Jesus, I thought my love life was crazy...

question: David isn't hiding from me, I left him standing at the altar six years ago and now I'm...
answer: Fuck the details, they're always to blame... Look, too many of these guys duck out on us, especially after they become doctors or lawyers. I see it at my company all day long! So I'm just gonna make sure you get your, you know, fairy tale ending or whatever...

question: Rosa, I can't believe you're doing all this for me...thank you.
answer: Hey, how 'bout a card for me? What is that? "Please call if you have any information on David Ravell." This is my phone number! How many of these have you given out?

question: How many men have I talked to?
answer: Jesus! They're all gonna be calling me!

question: You said in L.A., anything goes.
answer: I was talking about what you could wear!

question: See, in a LeSabre Betty's probably getting twenty-two, maybe twenty-five miles to the gallon, where we're topping out at fifteen.
answer: What the hell's the matter with you?

question: That was a really shitty thing to do.
answer: I'm sick of looking at her mother-fucking face.

question: Don't talk like that. She's my last one, Wesley, my final target. Don't you realize your special, that you represent something?
answer: What? What does she represent?! What could some cornbread white bitch from Kansas who's dragging our sorry asses up and down the Louisiana Purchase possibly mean to you?!! I'd just love to know...

question: I dunno... something.
answer: I don't know, but when we find her she's gonna die for it. Can you describe her to me?... Okay... Yeah, that sounds like her... Thanks.

question: How'd they describe her?
answer: You know, blonde, thin, whatever...

question: Not so fast! Slower... 'blonde, thin', yes... Did they say she had style? A kind of grace or anything?
answer: How do I get this fucking thing down?

question: What do you think my father would do if I told him I didn't want to be a lawyer anymore?
answer: Probably the same thing my mom would do if I got engaged... have a heart attack.

question: So how's it going with your new roomie? What's her name?
answer: Betty. It's O.K. except I'm worn out. We spent all weekend looking for her

question: So tell her to settle for the old one in Orange County.
answer: She's gonna have to 'cause I'm out of ideas.

question: Maybe we're suing him for malpractice. What's his name again?
answer: David Ravell.

question: God, that sounds so familiar. Ravell, Ravell... where's he out of?
answer: I'm not sure now. She said he used to be over at Loma Vista. I never heard of it.

question: Loma Vista? You mean like the guy on "A Reason to Love?"
answer: Guess who I saw today.

question: Guess who I saw today.
answer: Who?

question: Doctor David Ravell.
answer: What? Where was he?!

question: ON TELEVISION!! Cut the shit, will you! Either you're making a fool out of me because you get off on it, or you got serious problems. Which one is it?!
answer: I have no idea what you're talking about.

question: I'M TALKING ABOUT DAVID RAVELL!!
answer: Shhh! I heard you the first time.

question: I spent my weekend looking for someone who does - not - exist. I should have been here at the hospital with my brother, but I was with you.
answer: If you didn't want to do it, you should have said so! Is this about gas money?

question: IT'S NOT ABOUT GAS MONEY!!
answer: Are you having a nervous breakdown?

question: I helped you because I'm an idiot! Ask my mother, I love it when people take advantage of me! I TRUSTED YOU!! I THOUGHT HE WAS REAL!
answer: HE IS REAL!!

question: You need help, Betty! Even if this is your idea of a joke, you need SERIOUS HELP!! Necesitas un mdico! Pront simo!
answer: Fine.

question: You're wastin' your time, Roy.
answer: Look Joyce, I need your key to the files, not advice, okay? This is a complex case.

question: Nothin' complex about it. Del's dead, Betty's gone. She's probably dead, too.
answer: You'd like that wouldn't you? You've hated Betty since you were in Pep Squad together...

question: No... before that.
answer: Ahh, I hate this town! Places like this just make you small...

question: Blah - blah - blah... Hurry up, will ya, I got a date tonight...
answer: Names, a phone number, something...

question: What did you say?
answer: The driver was killed. I think there's a connection--

question: No, about... Are you talking about Duane Cooley?
answer: Yeah. Why, you know him?

question: I know you don't use them, but if you wanna keep 'em you'll back out of there slowly...
answer: Come on, Elden, think about it. The driver, all them trunks standing open like that... something's going on here!

question: I know that...
answer: Well, do something, then, damnit!

question: You watch your mouth when you're in a goddamn county vehicle... You don't think I see what's going on? Del, now this Cooley fella, both of 'em mixed up with Joyce... 'S not no conspiracy, not some episode off the X-Files... 's just a crime of passion, plain and simple. Betty's on some kind'a pre-minstral rampage, that's what is going on here.
answer: Oww... Did you have to make these things so tight?

question: Don't worry, I'm looking... just taking a tiny break.
answer: This is crazy. I come home, you go to your room. You go in the kitchen, I go to my room. It's stupid.

question: ...okay.
answer: Oh, it's a charity dinner. The money goes to a good cause, but I don't have anybody to go with...

question: Umm...
answer: ...you hungry at all?

question: We should go.
answer: We don't have time to look at a hole in the ground. We can make Vegas in four hours. This one's got to be her.

question: It's a very moving experience, trust me.
answer: No.

question: One of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World.
answer: No... be dark before we get there. You wanna see the Grand Canyon at night?

question: What difference does it make? She wasn't in Kansas City, or Houston, or Dallas. We
answer: I said, 'No.' N-O.

question: "When I grow up I'm going to become a nurse or a veterinarian. I always want to help people and value all life, be it animal, plant or mineral..." Does that sound like a goddamn showgirl to you?
answer: Do you hear yourself right now...? Like a fucking madman...

question: Every American should see the Grand Canyon. Are you an American?
answer: Yes, I am and we're not going. Act professional.

question: I married a car salesman. Why are you calling him George?
answer: Oh, you mean Fred.

question: No, Del.
answer: Right, Del. Del was one hot salesman. Of cars. He could talk anyone into anything.

question: You knew Del?!
answer: Honey, I didn't want to tell you at the time, but Del and I go way back. We went to school together. In fact, he saved my life. Two more minutes in that icy water and I would have drowned. But Del jumped in and grabbed me. We fell out of touch eventually, but I still owe him one.

question: I can't tell you how much it hurts me to hear that you married him.
answer: I'm so sorry. Life makes us do awful things sometimes.

question: I tried to tell myself it was for the best, that there was a reason behind it. But... Del?
answer: There was no plan! I was just young and stupid and scared!

question: You never gave us a chance...
answer: I know that. I can't tell you how many times I've said that to myself in those exact words.

question: Hey, don't... come on, I was just... you're not really crying, are you?... I was just playing along...
answer: Why do they keep calling you George?

question: Yeah?
answer: Mr. Campbell?

question: Huh?
answer: Is this Neighborly Life Insurance?

question: Oh, umm, yes, this is Dwight Campbell.
answer: It's Sue Ann Rogers, Betty Sizemore's friend? I heard from her.

question: ... you have a good time? You make a little wish?
answer: Where? Where is she?

question: I'm not telling.
answer: What?

question: I'm not telling 'til you straighten up. You been acting like fucking Jerry Lewis on me and this shit's gotta stop or you can forget about your Betty... I mean it.
answer: Wesley, I'm fine... just tell me where she is.

question: Lyla's very nice.
answer: Yes, she is.

question: She told me I was charming and relentless, and would go far in this town. And she said that unlike the other charming, relentless people she knew, she liked me.
answer: She's a good person to know.

question: Carleton School of Nursing. Two semesters, but Del made me give it up...
answer: Alright, okay... I think you broke the record for staying in character about three hours ago.

question: You told me that two hours ago.
answer: What happened when you were twelve?

question: For Mother's Day, I used all my allowance that I'd been saving to take my mother to Kansas City. We got our nails done and had lunch at "Skies," a restaurant at the top of a building from where you can see the whole city. It was the last outing we took together. She died the following year.
answer: Wow ... You just gave me goosebumps, you know that? You make it all sound so real. Great improv...

question: I just want everything to be perfect between us.
answer: I know. Listen, we need to take a time out here. Can we talk seriously for a minute?

question: Of course.
answer: At last! I know how much you want this. You're gifted and extremely determined, but ... it's not up to me.

question: I know. It's up to us.
answer: Were you with him this whole time?

question: Oh, God! You scared me! Yes...
answer: You still in love? Does he know you think he's real?

question: He is real.
answer: Uh-huh... So, what'd you talk about?

question: Oh, my gosh, everything! My trip out here, what we've both been doing, you know...
answer: No, I'm not sure I could begin to imagine... So, where'd you go?

question: To a party in the Hollywood Hills.
answer: Was it a huge place? With a view of the whole world?

question: Yes. I'd never been in a place like that before.
answer: I have, lots of times. My mother used to clean them. I used to piss in their pools.

question: No, almost never.
answer: But, you're in love with someone who doesn't exist. You come here, you meet this guy, who should laugh in your face, and instead you leave with him!

question: Elden, let me out of here. Now! This is ridiculous, I need medical attention!
answer: That's a nice name for what you need...

question: Come on, I have to get this dressing off...it itches! And what about my fish? Who is taking care of them?
answer: Just shut up a second and listen... That, uh... that bar in Arizona? Where you said Betty was?

question: What about it?
answer: Any idea where it is?

question: Little place called "Williams," why?
answer: I just got something off the wire. The woman who owns it was murdered last night.

question: She makes me stretch! I got inside my character last night like I haven't done in six years on "Reason". It was a totally rejuvenating experience.
answer: I know, George, I was there. I'm not denying that she's good.

question: She's even taken a job as a nurse!
answer: We know that...

question: Can I have an evil twin?
answer: No, George, we've already done that with Lonnie. The blind one last year, remember?

question: Oh, of course. Who can forget the Emmy?
answer: I don't know, George...

question: I'll tell the cast ahead of time. What do you say?
answer: I'll think about it.

question: It'll be like live television! Let's live on the edge a little. You and I can break the mold here!
answer: I said I'll think about it.

question: Fine, but promise me one thing. If we use her, I want to direct those episodes. She's my discovery.
answer: Actually, she was my discovery... just like you.

question: Hmm?
answer: "Would you like ground pepper on that salad, Ms. Branch?" Remember?

question: So you believed the bartender. Why?
answer: Well... I think I saw her soul.

question: That's good. You're learning. But let me tell you why I know she was lying.
answer: I dunno, that lady sounded pretty sure...

question: No, no, Betty came here strictly for business, 'cause it's the biggest market for what she's selling. I should have known it all along. I'm kicking myself as I shave here. So, first thing we...
answer: Wait, wait, wait a minute... that doesn't make sense.

question: What doesn't?
answer: You gimme this bullshit Psychic Friends theory, you believe that dumbshit trucker, you believe this woman...

question: I never said that I believed...
answer: No, you believed her, we drove all the way to L.A. so that means you trusted her that much... so why's the rest of her story suddenly so kooky? Huh?

question: 'Cause I just don't buy it. Call it instinct. Call it 35 years of professional know-how...
answer: I call it 'nutty' as my shit after I eat Almond Roca...

question: You need to remember who you're talking to...
answer: I need to get my goddamn head examined.

question: Wesley...
answer: "It's beneath her..." She's a mother fucking housewife... nothing's beneath her!

question: Boy, you need to get outta my face... now! You got a feeling, then you do what you gotta do, but don't you ever try to tell me my job. Not ever.
answer: Fine. Just fine... I'll go check some shit on my own then. And don't call me 'boy...' ... what kinda car's Jasmine drive? Yeah? The sport utility? Damn, that's sweet... Oh fuck...

question: Are you sure I can borrow this?
answer: No, please. Go ahead, it's your funeral...

question: Rosa...
answer: Well, what if this guy's just playing with you? What if he's lying about who he is?

question: You should have a little faith in people.
answer: Does he ever talk about medicine? His patients, the hospital?

question: Oh, he does that. It's this silly game he plays. Half the people who know him call him George.
answer: I don't think your friend likes me.

question: She's a little jealous, I think. And confused when it comes to men...
answer: Well, first I thought Patina, and then the Ivy, but then I thought of somewhere a little more romantic. Like my place. God, I haven't felt like this since I was with Stella Adler in New York. You're so...real.

question: You never mentioned a 'Stella' to me.
answer: Didn't I?

question: No, I would have remembered that name. The only Stella I ever knew was a parrot.
answer: I've never met anyone like you, Betty.

question: I know, that's why we were meant to be together...
answer: No, I mean your dedication scares me...

question: It's easy to be dedicated, when you care about something...
answer: Yeah, I felt that way, too, when I first started, but now... the hours, the repetition... it's not all glamour and mall openings anymore. Maybe I should've listened to my people and tried to make the crossover to nights earlier, I don't know...

question: ...but I love listening to you, so that's okay...
answer: Thanks. But I'd like to hear what you're feeling...

question: Well, I just feel that life'll be much sweeter for you now with me around. I promise...
answer: You know, I almost believe that... you're like a warm breeze that's suddenly blown into my life... I said that to Leslie, once, at her funeral, remember?...

question: I remember. You said it to her, but it was meant for me, wasn't it?
answer: Yes... maybe it was.

question: ...so I'm standing there, minding my own business on Hollywood Blvd., checking out Gladys Knight's star-thing there, I look up at this little souvenir shop dude, Chinese dude, reading a paper... and who do I see? That's Lonnie. He's the show's Main Prick. And that is definitely Betty. Now, that ain't no coincidence...
answer: Who's this?

question: A doctor on the show... why?
answer: It just didn't fit her profile...

question: Fuck the profile! That's the same guy!!
answer: She can't be here because of a... a soap opera. Not a soap opera. That'd make her...

question: ... crazy! No shit, Shaft!! And you ain't far behind...
answer: ... but she's, no, Betty's smarter than that. She wouldn't be here for a...

question: I do not know how the fuck you lasted an hour in this job! Dragging our asses around with the answer to our prayers in your motherfucking jacket... a picture of that cunt right next to the...
answer: Don't Don't you talk about Betty like that. I don't care who she ends up being, you never use that word again. Got it?

question: Man, you have got to get some therapy.
answer: I said 'got it?'

question: ... yeah, I got it. Come on, you're stretching out my vest...
answer: You made your point... I was wrong.

question: If you need a minute, that's okay. But I thought you'd want to--
answer: David, I don't... Can we talk privately for a second?

question: Stop calling me David. We're on set, for Christ's sake, you don't have to call me David here.
answer: Why are you doing this to me?

question: Why am I doing this to you? Isn't this what you wanted?
answer: Is there a problem, George?

question: No! No problem, there is no... What is the problem? Just do that... thing... you do! Come on! You drove me nuts with this for three days, now do it!
answer: All right, everybody! That's ten minutes!

question: No! Let me try this!
answer: Forget it, George. It was a gamble, it didn't work. Nice try.

question: Let me try this, goddamnit! SHE'S BEEN DOING IT ALL WEEK, SHE CAN DO IT NOW!
answer: I SAID FORGET IT!

question: Well, I don't know what you had in mind, but I hope you're happy. I put myself on the line for you, my reputation, and you're making me look like an idiot.
answer: What do you mean? What did I do to you...

question: Who put you up to this? Did my ex-wife ask you to...?
answer: David, please--

question: STOP CALLING ME THAT! MY NAME IS NOT DAVID, AND IF YOU REALLY DON'T KNOW THE DIFFERENCE, YOU'RE MORE FUCKED UP THAN I THOUGHT YOU WERE! SHUT THE FUCK UP!! You're a fucking grip, go grip something!!! And you're not an actress, you're nothing but a soap opera groupie, aren't you? YOU HAVE NOTHING BETTER TO DO! DO YOU?? Well, why don't you get a fucking life, and stop ruining mine!
answer: I'm sorry...Oh my gosh, are you George McCord?!

question: ...What? What did you call me?
answer: George...McCord. You're my favorite actor on...

question: ...did I win some contest?
answer: But I'm David... I mean, I'm not David, but she thinks I am! You heard her... Stop staring at me... I'm not crazy, she is!

question: Why are you screaming at me? I mean, what am I... why am I here? I don't...
answer: You're doing this now? After all the.. are you sick? Are you going to kill me now?

question: No, I... I'll leave. Forgive me if I caused you all any trouble... I just, I don't know how I... ... I'm sorry.
answer: What?! What can I do for you, gentlemen?

question: What?! What can I do for you, gentlemen?
answer: How do you do, Mr. McCord. We're trying to locate a deranged fan of yours,... a Ms. Betty...

question: Deranged. That would be the right word.
answer: Thanks so much. You must get bothered by this kind of thing a lot.

question: More than you know. Is there anything else?
answer: No, that should be more than--

question: Good.
answer: Actually, there is one more thing.

question: You thought wrong.
answer: It's just for an autograph. It's not for me...

question: It never is.
answer: You need to learn some manners, friend... reach out to your goddamn fan base a little more.

question: What the hell are you doing here?
answer: I came for love...

question: You're not on that soap opera thing again, are you? 'Cause you know what that is?
answer: It's people with no lives watching other people's fake lives.

question: That's right. So, if you know it, why are you in trouble?
answer: I don't know.

question: Bet-ty!? Did the pizza guy show up yet?
answer: I'm going back to... I need to... I don't know.

question: Where are you going?
answer: I have to leave now.

question: What? No, I'm not gonna let you just run out of here... You need to talk about what's going on...
answer: You think I'm crazy, Rosa, but you don't know the half of it. My husband was, ahh...

question: Your husband?!
answer: Yes, I had a husband and he was killed two weeks ago in my kitchen. I was right there...

question: Jesus!... What are you saying?
answer: I don't know. I'm just starting to remember it now. I don't...

question: Yeah, but your running away isn't going to help you with all this...
answer: There was blood everywhere, Rosa. I saw it, I think I watched the whole thing happen... Oh my God...

question: Whoa! What the fuck're you doing here?
answer: Well, you were right about what that bartender said.

question: But you were right first. You gotta follow your instincts.
answer: What do your instincts tell you to do now, kid?

question: Leave. Take this shit back to Detroit and get the rest of our money.
answer: We could do that. I could be on my way to Florida, and you could go to Thailand and fuck your brains out.

question: ...but that's not what we're gonna do, is it?
answer: No... if we don't finish this job, how are we gonna look at ourselves in the mirror? This is it for me, Wesley, she's the last one. My instinct says I gotta see this through with her, and if there's one thing I've tried to teach you here--

question: It's to follow my instincts. And my instincts say get the fuck out of Dodge.
answer: No, I said to follow 'my' instincts. Now, we go up there and conclude our business. Case closed.

question: ... oh, that's fucking democratic.
answer: I'm Detective Jefferson--

question: Betty! Boy, am I glad to see you!
answer: Roy! What are you doing here?

question: You're in serious danger!
answer: Ahh, look, right now's not very...

question: ... I s'pose you did that so I could take my sweater off or something.
answer: No, just stand there... lemme look at you a minute.

question: ... I... I know what you are.
answer: Do you know why I'm here?

question: I've got a pretty good idea. You're here to kill me, so kill me. You want me to be afraid, but I'm not. I don't care who you are, or why you two killed my husband...
answer: You really... didn't have anything to do with what Del was doing, did you?

question: I have no idea what he was mixed up in... it was always something.
answer: So you weren't involved with him in his pathetic attempt to diversify? Were you mixed up in the drugs, Betty?

question: Drugs? God, no! I'm totally against drugs.
answer: Damn, life is strange. I had you figured for this cold-blooded, calculating bitch-- Not that I didn't admire you for it.

question: ... well, if you're not going to slit my throat, why'd you come up here?
answer: ... to see you.

question: --small-time, pissant, Barney Fife--
answer: SHUT UP! Shut the fuck up, both of you, before I kill you!

question: I'm the one who watched the show...I was...
answer: Did Chloe crack?

question: Totally. She came apart like a house of cards. They dropped the charges...
answer: Goddamn... how 'bout Jasmine?

question: She's a lesbian.
answer: You lie, motherfucker...

question: I swear to God!
answer: What?! You scream, you die.

question: ... I never meet people like you. I'm a garbageman of the human conditon. I deal with trash, mostly, people willing to trade any part of themselves for a few more minutes of their rotten lives. But you... you're different.
answer: I am?

question: Sure. You could probably have any thing you wanted... somebody as beautiful and stylish as yourself, and you don't even realize it.
answer: Umm, I don't think that...

question: Wait. Let me get this out. I like the symphony, walks in the rain, sunsets, animals and children. I read passionately, and I like to discuss things. I'm basically conservative, but flexible. I've been involved in the death of thirty-two people, but I can live with that because the world is lighter by thirty-two pieces of shit, excuse my language.
answer: "Thirty-two?"

question: Well, thirty-three, but I'm not counting Del, on account of you... so, what do you think?
answer: I don't feel that, no. I just....I'm not really who you think I am.

question: No one is, honey. Here, listen to this... "If who I am and who I hope to be should meet one day, I know they will be friends." Now that's beautiful.
answer: I wrote that when I was twelve... where'd you get that?!

question: I know. I borrowed it from your grandparents because I... I... it doesn't matter. Don't worry, they're fine... Look, I used to feel that same way, said practically those same words, sitting at night in a foxhole in Korea...
answer: I thought you were a garbageman of humanity, or something.

question: Oh, Christ, they shot my boy!
answer: I'm sorry.

question: You're sorry? YOU'RE THE REASON WE'RE HERE!
answer: WAIT A SECOND! I AM NOT THE REASON YOU'RE HERE! I WAS MINDING MY OWN BUSINESS, LIVING A PERFECTLY BORING LIFE UNTIL YOU CAME ALONG!

question: Lady, you don't just run away from crime... besides, Betty's in there.
answer: You wanna see if he has more shells, go ahead. I say we wait...

question: No, no, no... you don't know shit about procedure! You don't send your best...
answer: I've got the working gun, Elden, me! You wasted all your bullets so you crawl out there.

question: If we went out that window right now we'd have a chance...
answer: I better go check on them.

question: Wait, Betty... you still haven't answered me.
answer: This is really awkward...

question: Ahh, it's too late, anyway. It's too late.
answer: I'd rather not...

question: Betty, I don't wanna shrivel up alone in some stinking prison. No way. I've got some professional pride. And I don't want anybody else to get the credit for taking me out.
answer: ...what're you saying?

question: When a Roman general knew a battle was lost, he'd throw himself on his sword.
answer: Yes... Not the actor, though, the doctor. I think.

question: So all this...really was because of that soap opera? My son is dead because you came out here to be with that doctor? A fake doctor?
answer: I wouldn't have put it quite that way, but...

question: Wesley didn't even want to come up here. He warned me, but I insisted...
answer: I don't think I am.

question: This story is beyond belief, which is perfect for us. It's free advertising and it's gonna run for months.
answer: I don't think she can do it. You saw what happened.

question: You fucked it up. Who wouldn't freeze in those circumstances? And I don't care what her problems are. She wouldn't be the first one in that cast with problems. We have nothing to lose by making her an offer.
answer: What about me? Don't you wanna know how I feel about it? I'm the one who...

question: Why would I give a shit how you feel. And I got news for you. I loved your 'icy water' idea the other day... I'm toying
answer: That's not a bad idea. How many episodes before he comes back?

question: Then do as you're told. Get her back.
answer: I'm sorry for what I did. It was inexcusable. I'm sorry for the things I said, and for not respecting you, and for all the stupid things that...

question: I'm sorry for what I did. It was inexcusable. I'm sorry for the things I said, and for not respecting you, and for all the stupid things that...
answer: When you have a minute...

question: Look, I don't really like the whole idea of autographs, and I'm kind of in the middle of...
answer: Don't flatter yourself. It's the check.

question: Oh. Of course... sorry.
answer: My treat. You were saying... something about how stupid you've been?

question: Right... I was. I was an idiot, plain and simple, and I hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me. How's that?
answer: Kinda like you'd been saying it since you got on the plane...

question: I have... did it sound that bad?
answer: Mmm-hmm. Listen, I forgive you, Mr. McCord...

question: George...
answer: ... George. I do.

question: Thanks...
answer: ... it's too bad you're such an asshole. 'S the only thing that Del was ever right about.

question: No, that's... okay. Fair enough.
answer: ... there's always a chance, David.

question: ... there's always a chance, David.
answer: Right. But will there be a tomorrow, and the next day, and the next?

question: Doctor, if you were any handsomer it'd be a crime...
answer: I guess that means you're free tonight. Of course, it's up to you...
